info.title: eWallet API
info.description:
This is the documentation for the eWallet client API.
Client calls are authorized using the 'Authorization' HTTP header with the following format:

- Client: `Authorization=OMGClient Base64(api_key:authentication_token)`
Due to HTTP-RPC nature, the API will always return a `200` HTTP status, including on errors. Only in case of an internal server error that `500` will be returned.

Error codes are available in [html](./errors), [json](./errors.json) and [yaml](./errors.yaml) formats.

tags.name: User
tags.description: Resources related to users. A user is an entity uniquely identified by its provider_user_id which is the user id in the provider database.

tags.name: Wallet
tags.description: Resources related to wallets of a specific user. Wallets contains the balances of tokens that users and accounts own.

tags.name: TransactionRequest
tags.description: Resources related to the creation of transaction requests (either receiving or sending) that needs to be consumed by another user.

tags.name: TransactionConsumption
tags.description: Resources related to consumption of transaction requests.

tags.name: Setting
tags.description: Resources related to global settings of the wallet.

post.summary: Login to retrieve a user's authentication_token.
Verify the email for a user
Get the user corresponding to the provided authentication token.
Get the wallets of a specific user. The client can call this to get the wallets of the user corresponding to the authentication_token provided.
Get the list of transactions for the current user.
Transfer the specified amount to a wallet.

LoginBody.description: The parameters to use for logging in a user

UserSignupBody.description: The parameters to use for signing up a user

UserVerifyEmailBody.description: The parameters to use for verifying a user's email

ProviderIdBody.description: The parameters to use for providing a provider user id

TransactionsBody.description: The parameters to use to customize the returned list of transactions.

UserTransactionsBody.description: The parameters to use to customize the returned list of transactions.

CurrentUserTransactionsBody.description: The parameters to use to customize the returned list of transactions.

TransactionBody.description: The parameters for making a transfer from an address to another.

CreateTransactionBody.description:
The parameters for making a transfer.
The from_address is optional, if specified it must belong to the current user.
If not specified, the user's primary wallet will be used.

ServerCreateTransactionRequestBody.description: Create a transaction request using the specified values. That request can then be consumed using a different endpoint to create a transaction from that request.

token_id.description: The token ID to use for the transaction.

amount.description: The amount to transfer. If not specified, the consumption will need to set the amount.

correlation_id.description: Optional unique identifier to tie a request with your system.

account_id.default: The owner of the given address.

provider_user_id.default: The owner of the given address.

address.description: If not specified, the current user's primary wallet will be used. If specified, it needs to be one of the account's or user's addresses.

require_confirmation.description: Indicates if a consumption of the created request needs to be approved before being processed.

max_consumptions.description: The number of times this created request can be consumed.

max_consumptions_per_user.description: The maximum number of times a user can consume the request.

consumption_lifetime.description: The lifetime in milliseconds of how long a consumption can stay 'pending' before being expired. If a consumption is not approved before its expiration date, it will become invalid and be cancelled. This property can be used to avoid stale consumptions blocking the 'max_consumptions' count.

expiration_date.description: The datetime at which the created request should expire (no one will be able to consume it anymore). The format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZZZZZ.

allow_amount_override.description: Defines if the amount set in the created request can be overriden in a consumption. Cannot be set to true if the amount property is not set at creation

ClientCreateTransactionRequestBody.description: Create a transaction request using the specified values. That request can then be consumed using a different endpoint by a different client to create a transaction from that request.

token_id.description: The token ID to use for the transaction.

amount.description: The amount to transfer. If not specified, the consumption will need to set the amount.

correlation_id.description: Optional unique identifier to tie a request with your system.

address.description: If not specified, the current user's primary wallet will be used. If specified, it needs to be one of the current user's addresses.

require_confirmation.description: Indicates if a consumption of the created request needs to be approved before being processed.

max_consumptions.description: The number of times this created request can be consumed.

max_consumptions_per_user.description: The maximum number of times a user can consume the request.

consumption_lifetime.description: The lifetime in milliseconds of how long a consumption can stay 'pending' before being expired. If a consumption is not approved before its expiration date, it will become invalid and be cancelled. This property can be used to avoid stale consumptions blocking the 'max_consumptions' count.

expiration_date.description: The datetime at which the created request should expire (no one will be able to consume it anymore). The format is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZZZZZ.

allow_amount_override.description: Defines if the amount set in the created request can be overriden in a consumption. Cannot be set to true if the amount property is not set at creation

GetTransactionRequestBody.description: Get a transaction request using the specified ID.

ServerConsumeTransactionRequestBody.description: Consume a transaction request using the specified values.

account_id.default: The owner of the given address.

provider_user_id.default: The owner of the given address.

address.description: If not specified, the current user's primary wallet will be used. If specified, it needs to be one of the account's or user's addresses.

ClientConsumeTransactionRequestBody.description: Consume a transaction request using the specified values.

ConsumptionConfirmationRequestBody.description: Approve or reject a consumption using the specified ID.
